bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Armistead Carter, August 18, 1917

div1.p: Carter writes about his health and financial matters. He would like to continue working for the Rockefeller Foundation in South America next winter.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Armistead Carter, August 18, 1917
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF
MEDICAL OFFICER IN CHARGE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
CUSTOMHOUSE, NORFOLK, VA.
Aug 18/17
My own Dear Daughter:
div1.p:
(1) Capt. Tull-Med. Reserve
Corps. Camp Meade has the
Book of Plates - Vol II - of the
Mosquito book- I wrote to
him last sunday to send
it in as soon as he had
identified the “wings” of
the Anopheles I sent him.

Grieved am I to hear of
Billings lea's death; He was
2
a good man & I had put him
“on to” his problem.

2) Your decision about the money is cor-
rect.- may be modified by my
$125. che $123 check coming it- It
is 123: not 128. - the addition was
wrong - by $5.00- That & $8.00 should
came in together

3) Send me some (3) handker-
chiefs- I brought only one. Di-
rect to Hotel Warwick. New-
Port News.

4) James Martin, whom I saw
last night, says that he has an
offer of $750. for 4 lots - & that
he thinks it best to take it. as
it may help to sell the others
3
It is alittle about less than the average we
gave for them but he thinks
these are not as good as the
average- at that rate they will
yield $3750- I gave for these
about that- I gave $4275 for all
but one has been given away & one
sold- (I think two sold.) It was a
bad investment - a loss of
about 7% per annum

I am going to write Gorgas tomor-
row - & accept the Rock express
my willingness for the Rocker-
feller work - Preferably next winter
4
OFFICE OF
MEDICAL OFFICER IN CHARGE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
CUSTOMHOUSE, NORFOLK, VA.
or spring: after Novem 15-
- when the Memphis Mal. Confer-
ence is over - would do very
well - but after Oct 15 if
necessary. I think this is
best

In re-Eloise- I too am sorry for
her Goucher decision, & I am sur-
prised at it. We will, if she
comes & we are in Balt., have
to offer her as few induce-
ments for visiting us as possible.
5
That I presume is about all
we can do. She will not come
where she does not have “a
good time”. Why she wants to
come to Balt. I can't imagine
unless she hasn't friends in
North Hampton.. What has
become of Prescott Clark?

Have finished this place-
ex. when by 1 P. M. - & will go
to New Port News Sunday
to begin work there. Time was
wasted here - by young - in both
6
OFFICE OF
MEDICAL OFFICER IN CHARGE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
CUSTOMHOUSE, NORFOLK, VA.
the malaria & the other survey.

Have a little rheumatism
in my left hip - the first touch
of anything of the sort since
a few days after leaving
Pernambuco. Began yester-
day morning

Also a touch of Poison Oak - on
my wrist- a slight affair
which sh'd go by Monday or
Tuesday

So you see I can balance your poor
dear eyes-
28

Dear love to your Mother & to
Sally- Tell the latter that “the
New Baby” - Louise - at James
Martin's is a very attractive
little thing. Bessie is away
in Pulaski

It seems that Chamfe- et als. get
the 10% raise - i.e. a total of $33.25
per week - which isn't bad. He pays
$6.00 per week - with out lunch - w'h costs
him about .25 per days =$7.75 - leaving
25.50 clear.
